citations.desc: Consignments to carriers and intermediate handlers.
citations.narrative:
A dog arrived at ORD on December 12, 2024 (checked baggage #132580 on IB 341) and the attached certification sticker
did not indicate the last time it was offered food and water and did not have specific instructions for the next feeding(s)
and watering(s) for a 24-hour period. Ensuring dogs were offered food and water helps maintain animal comfort and
health for transportation. Carriers must ensure consignors certify in writing that food and water was offered at least 4
hours prior to delivery for transport and also have specific food and watering instructions for a 24-hour period.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats.
citations.narrative:
On December 12, 2024 a dog on an inbound flight (checked baggage #132580 on IB 341) arrived at ORD in a transport
enclosure that was too small for it. Pictures demonstrate that the dog could not turn about normally while standing and
wouldn't be able to lie in a natural position. Enclosures that are too small can cause discomfort and stress to animals
transported in them. Primary enclosures used to transport live dogs and cats must be large enough to ensure that each
animal contained in the primary enclosure has enough space to turn about normally while standing, to stand and sit erect,
and to lie in a natural position.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspector: Chad Moore, Transportation Field Specialist
